member.name: T:Amazon.EC2InstanceConnect.Model.SendSerialConsoleSSHPublicKeyRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the SendSerialConsoleSSHPublicKey operation. Pushes an SSH public key to the specified EC2 instance. The key remains for 60 seconds, which gives you 60 seconds to establish a serial console connection to the instance using SSH. For more information, see EC2 Serial Console in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.EC2InstanceConnect.Model.SendSerialConsoleSSHPublicKeyRequest.InstanceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InstanceId.
The ID of the EC2 instance.

member.name: P:Amazon.EC2InstanceConnect.Model.SendSerialConsoleSSHPublicKeyRequest.SerialPort
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SerialPort.
The serial port of the EC2 instance. Currently only port 0 is supported.
Default: 0

member.name: P:Amazon.EC2InstanceConnect.Model.SendSerialConsoleSSHPublicKeyRequest.SSHPublicKey
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SSHPublicKey.
The public key material. To use the public key, you must have the matching private key. For information about the supported key formats and lengths, see Requirements for key pairs in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.

member.name: T:Amazon.EC2InstanceConnect.Model.SendSerialConsoleSSHPublicKeyResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the SendSerialConsoleSSHPublicKey operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.EC2InstanceConnect.Model.SendSerialConsoleSSHPublicKeyResponse.RequestId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RequestId.
The ID of the request. Please provide this ID when contacting AWS Support for assistance.

member.name: P:Amazon.EC2InstanceConnect.Model.SendSerialConsoleSSHPublicKeyResponse.Success
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Success.
Is true if the request succeeds and an error otherwise.

member.name: T:Amazon.EC2InstanceConnect.Model.SendSSHPublicKeyRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the SendSSHPublicKey operation. Pushes an SSH public key to the specified EC2 instance for use by the specified user. The key remains for 60 seconds. For more information, see Connect to your Linux instance using EC2 Instance Connect in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.EC2InstanceConnect.Model.SendSSHPublicKeyRequest.AvailabilityZone
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AvailabilityZone.
The Availability Zone in which the EC2 instance was launched.

member.name: P:Amazon.EC2InstanceConnect.Model.SendSSHPublicKeyRequest.InstanceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InstanceId.
The ID of the EC2 instance.

member.name: P:Amazon.EC2InstanceConnect.Model.SendSSHPublicKeyRequest.InstanceOSUser
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InstanceOSUser.
The OS user on the EC2 instance for whom the key can be used to authenticate.

member.name: P:Amazon.EC2InstanceConnect.Model.SendSSHPublicKeyRequest.SSHPublicKey
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SSHPublicKey.
The public key material. To use the public key, you must have the matching private key.

member.name: T:Amazon.EC2InstanceConnect.Model.SendSSHPublicKeyResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the SendSSHPublicKey operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.EC2InstanceConnect.Model.SendSSHPublicKeyResponse.RequestId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RequestId.
The ID of the request. Please provide this ID when contacting AWS Support for assistance.

member.name: P:Amazon.EC2InstanceConnect.Model.SendSSHPublicKeyResponse.Success
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Success.
Is true if the request succeeds and an error otherwise.

member.name: T:Amazon.EC2InstanceConnect.AmazonEC2InstanceConnectClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing EC2InstanceConnect
Amazon EC2 Instance Connect enables system administrators to publish one-time use SSH public keys to EC2, providing users a simple and secure way to connect to their instances.

member.name: M:Amazon.EC2InstanceConnect.AmazonEC2InstanceConnectClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonEC2InstanceConnectClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.EC2InstanceConnect.AmazonEC2InstanceConnectClient.#ctor(Amazon.RegionEndpoint)
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonEC2InstanceConnectClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>
member.param: The region to connect.

member.name: M:Amazon.EC2InstanceConnect.AmazonEC2InstanceConnectClient.#ctor(Amazon.EC2InstanceConnect.AmazonEC2InstanceConnectConfig)
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonEC2InstanceConnectClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>
member.param: The AmazonEC2InstanceConnectClient Configuration Object

member.name: M:Amazon.EC2InstanceConnect.AmazonEC2InstanceConnectClient.CreateSigner
member.summary: Creates the signer for the service.

member.name: P:Amazon.EC2InstanceConnect.AmazonEC2InstanceConnectClient.ServiceMetadata
member.summary: Capture metadata for the service.

member.name: M:Amazon.EC2InstanceConnect.AmazonEC2InstanceConnectClient.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Disposes the service client.

member.name: M:Amazon.EC2InstanceConnect.AmazonEC2InstanceConnectClient.SendSerialConsoleSSHPublicKey(Amazon.EC2InstanceConnect.Model.SendSerialConsoleSSHPublicKeyRequest)
member.summary: Pushes an SSH public key to the specified EC2 instance. The key remains for 60 seconds, which gives you 60 seconds to establish a serial console connection to the instance using SSH. For more information, see EC2 Serial Console in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the SendSerialConsoleSSHPublicKey service method.
member.returns: The response from the SendSerialConsoleSSHPublicKey service method, as returned by EC2InstanceConnect.
member.exception: Either your AWS credentials are not valid or you do not have access to the EC2 instance.
The specified instance was not found.
The instance type is not supported for connecting via the serial console. Only Nitro instance types are currently supported.
One of the parameters is not valid.

Your account is not authorized to use the EC2 Serial Console. To authorize your account, run the EnableSerialConsoleAccess API. For more information, see EnableSerialConsoleAccess in the Amazon EC2 API Reference.
The instance currently has 1 active serial console session. Only 1 session is supported at a time.
Unable to start a serial console session. Please try again.
The service encountered an error. Follow the instructions in the error message and try again.
The requests were made too frequently and have been throttled. Wait a while and try again. To increase the limit on your request frequency, contact AWS Support.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for SendSerialConsoleSSHPublicKey Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.EC2InstanceConnect.AmazonEC2InstanceConnectClient.SendSerialConsoleSSHPublicKeyAsync(Amazon.EC2InstanceConnect.Model.SendSerialConsoleSSHPublicKeyRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Pushes an SSH public key to the specified EC2 instance. The key remains for 60 seconds, which gives you 60 seconds to establish a serial console connection to the instance using SSH. For more information, see EC2 Serial Console in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the SendSerialConsoleSSHPublicKey service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the SendSerialConsoleSSHPublicKey service method, as returned by EC2InstanceConnect.
member.exception: Either your AWS credentials are not valid or you do not have access to the EC2 instance.
The specified instance was not found.
The instance type is not supported for connecting via the serial console. Only Nitro instance types are currently supported.
One of the parameters is not valid.

Your account is not authorized to use the EC2 Serial Console. To authorize your account, run the EnableSerialConsoleAccess API. For more information, see EnableSerialConsoleAccess in the Amazon EC2 API Reference.
The instance currently has 1 active serial console session. Only 1 session is supported at a time.
Unable to start a serial console session. Please try again.
The service encountered an error. Follow the instructions in the error message and try again.
The requests were made too frequently and have been throttled. Wait a while and try again. To increase the limit on your request frequency, contact AWS Support.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for SendSerialConsoleSSHPublicKey Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.EC2InstanceConnect.AmazonEC2InstanceConnectClient.SendSSHPublicKey(Amazon.EC2InstanceConnect.Model.SendSSHPublicKeyRequest)
member.summary: Pushes an SSH public key to the specified EC2 instance for use by the specified user. The key remains for 60 seconds. For more information, see Connect to your Linux instance using EC2 Instance Connect in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the SendSSHPublicKey service method.
member.returns: The response from the SendSSHPublicKey service method, as returned by EC2InstanceConnect.
member.exception: Either your AWS credentials are not valid or you do not have access to the EC2 instance.
The specified instance was not found.
One of the parameters is not valid.
The service encountered an error. Follow the instructions in the error message and try again.
The requests were made too frequently and have been throttled. Wait a while and try again. To increase the limit on your request frequency, contact AWS Support.
